column1: As you know , the suffix ONLINE is purely descriptive and now used by many companies .
column2: As you know , the suffix On @@line is pure @@ly description @@ive and now use @@ed by many company @@s .

column1: Therefore , any trade mark registration that incorporates the word ONLINE as a suffix in the way that you use it will not enable its owner to prevent others from using the word ONLINE .
column2: There @@fore , any trade mark register @@ation that in @@corporate @@s the word On @@line as a suffix in the way that you use it will not en @@able it @@s own @@er to prevent other @@s from use @@ing the word On @@line .

column1: Given the above , if you have adequate protection for the word ENRON ( which covers the services that you offer on - line as well as your core activities ) , I 'd say that another application for the words ENRON ONLINE is probably unnecessary .

column1: * Offers a 7.5 cent / dth rate to large customers while minimizing rate changes to other customers , minimizing the incentive for these customers to seek to bypass local transmission charges and other CPUC - approved charges . *

The short forms do not contain the optionality relating to our performing billing services -- all of our midmarket forms anticipate that we will act as customer 's billing agent and that we will collect all amounts due related to T&D and the like from the customer ( and reflect same on our invoice ) and pass those amounts on to the customer 's utility .

column1: A state Senate committee is set today to start serving 16 subpoenas on electricity producers and officials who manage California 's energy grid to determine whether they acted in concert to manipulate energy prices .
column2: A state Senate commit @@ee is set today to start serve @@ing 16 subpoena @@s on electric @@ity produce @@er @@s and office @@ial @@s who manage California 's energy grid to determine whether they act @@ed in concert to manipulate energy price @@s .

column1: The investigative committee , headed by state Sen. Joe Dunn , D - Santa Ana , is focusing on a series of events last fall filled with enough Shakespearean plot twists and intrigue that it has earned a name around the Capitol : " the palace coup . "
column2: The in @@vestigate @@ive commit @@ee , head @@ed by state Sen. Joe Dunn , D - Santa Ana , is focus @@ing on a serie @@s of event @@s last fall fill @@ed with enough Shakespeare @@ean plot twist @@s and intrigue that it have @@s earn @@ed a name a @@round the Capitol : " the palace coup . "

column1: Lawmakers and consumer groups allege that the events - directed by the man who heads the state 's energy grid - fueled the California energy crisis , pushed the state into the power - buying business and helped make billions of dollars for power producers .
column2: Lawmaker @@s and consume @@er group @@s allege that the event @@s - direct @@ed by the man who head @@s the state 's energy grid - fuel @@ed the California energy crisis , push @@ed the state in @@to the power - buy @@ing busy @@ness and help @@ed make bi @@illion @@s of dollar @@s for power produce @@er @@s .

column1: The central question behind the palace coup is whether Terry Winter , the president of the Independent System Operator , acted alone when he took steps to remove key price caps designed to limit the amount power generators could charge .
column2: The centre @@al question be @@hind the palace coup is whether Terry Winter , the president of the Independent System Opera @@ate @@or , act @@ed alone when he took step @@s to re @@move key price cap @@s design @@ed to limit the amount power generate @@ion @@or @@s could charge .

column1: Winter defied his own board and Gov. Gray Davis when he filed a 50 - page request to remove the caps , records and interviews show .
column2: Winter defy @@ed his own board and Gov. Gray Davis when he file @@ed a 50 - page request to re @@move the cap @@s , record @@s and interview @@s show .

column1: I do n't know how these events could have taken place without some concerted effort ,  said Dunn .
column2: I do n't know how these event @@s could have take @@en place with @@out some concert @@ed effort ,  say @@ed Dunn .

column1: Davis spokesman Steve Maviglio said the governor felt " betrayed " by the actions of Winter .
column2: Davis spokesman Steve Maviglio say @@ed the govern @@or felt " be @@tray @@ed " by the act @@ion @@s of Winter .

column1: The governor believes it was the defining moment , when what was a mounting problem turned into an instant crisis ,  Maviglio said .
column2: The govern @@or believe @@s it was the define @@ing moment , when what was a mount @@ing problem turn @@ed in @@to an instant crisis ,  Maviglio say @@ed .

column1: Winter refused comment , referring all questions to the public relations office .
column2: Winter re @@fuse @@ed comment , refer @@ing all question @@s to the public relate @@ion @@s office .

column1: ISO spokesman Gregg Fishman said Dunn 's committee will find no criminal conduct .
column2: ISO spokesman Gregg Fish @@man say @@ed Dunn 's commit @@ee will find no crime @@al conduct .

column1: The decision was made by ISO upper management with one goal in mind : to keep the lights on .
column2: The decide @@ion was made by ISO upper manage @@ment with one goal in mind : to keep the light @@s on .

column1: At the time , generators were refusing to sell power in California because of the price caps .
column2: At the time , generate @@ion @@or @@s were re @@fuse @@ing to sell power in California because of the price cap @@s .

column1: It was an emergency ,  Fishman said .
column2: It was an emerge @@ence @@y ,  Fish @@man say @@ed .

column1: We had to take action . ''	 We have @@ed to take act @@ion . ''
They ( electricity generators ) grinned and beared the $ 750 price cap , but this new plan by ISO was too much ,  said Dunn , whose committee has been investigating since March .
column2: They ( electric @@ity generate @@ion @@or @@s ) grin @@ed and bear @@ed the $ 750 price cap , but this new plan by ISO was too much ,  say @@ed Dunn , whose commit @@ee have @@s be @@en in @@vestigate @@ing since March .

column1: All hell broke loose . ''	 All hell broke loose . ''
Records show that on Oct. 31 , power generators and electricity traders filed letters with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission , demanding that the new plan be killed .
column2: Record @@s show that on Oct. 31 , power generate @@ion @@or @@s and electric @@ity trade @@er @@s file @@ed let @@er @@s with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission , demand @@ing that the new plan be kill @@ed .

column1: If not removed immediately , the ( ISO ) price cap will sow confusion in the market , threaten reliability and stifle new investment in generating capacity , '' read one letter written by Duke Energy Vice President William Hall III .	 If not re @@move @@ed im @@mediate @@ly , the ( ISO ) price cap will sow confuse @@ion in the market , threat @@en rely @@able @@ity and stifle new invest @@ment in generate @@ing capacity , '' read one let @@er write @@en by Duke Energy Vice President William Hall III .

Although there is nothing illegal about the generators acting together to lobby against price caps , Dunn believes the letters and other actions around the same time showed clear coordination among energy officials .
column2: Although there is no @@thing il @@legal about the generate @@ion @@or @@s act @@ing together to lobby again @@st price cap @@s , Dunn believe @@s the let @@er @@s and other act @@ion @@s a @@round the same time show @@ed clear coordinate @@ion among energy office @@ial @@s .

column1: He said the main aim of the subpoenas will be to determine whether collusion occurred to " fix " prices , which would violate federal trade laws .
column2: He say @@ed the main aim of the subpoena @@s will be to determine whether collude @@ion occur @@ed to " fix " price @@s , which would violate federal trade law @@s .

column1: In the Oct. 31 letters , electricity producers told federal officials that if price caps were n't removed it would lead to a collapse of the energy market .
column2: In the Oct. 31 let @@er @@s , electric @@ity produce @@er @@s told federal office @@ial @@s that if price cap @@s were n't re @@move @@ed it would lead to a collapse of the energy market .

column1: The generators got their way .
column2: The generate @@ion @@or @@s got their way .

column1: The next day , the federal commission killed the new pricing plan .
column2: The next day , the federal commission kill @@ed the new price @@ing plan .
